intro: Chuquiraga spinosa subsp. huamanpinta, commonly known as the Huamanpinta burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
